page.title: 17OUTDOOR PURSUITS IN FERNESS
page.content: The area around Ferness is suitable for hiking, orienteering and is also used occasionally for scout camps. Forest paths provide routes for riders from the nearby riding school. On the hills grouse shooting is a major activity, while pheasant shooting takes place in the wooded areas. Some roe deer stalking is available from the Forestry Commission. The River Findhorn provides excellent salmon fishing while its rapids give good sport for canoeing. The wildlife of the area is rich and varied, and attracts birdwatchers and botanists alike. The local teacher at the turn of the century was an authority in this field and in 1900 wrote a book on the natural history of the parish.
